reviewText: Thursday's Child This wonderful made for television movie has long been out of print. The quality of this DVD version is very disappointing. It seems it has been made from an old video copy. The color is poor and the video seems out of focus at times. This could not have been mastered from an original source. Too bad as this is a great movie.
Great movie but very poor quality DVD. Blurry picture and garbled sound.
I shouldn't have read the book before purchasing the movie.
recieved the movie its a good one
I remember this movie when it first came out. Don't know why I thought of it out of the blue, but when I did I decided to order it. Enjoyed it again like way back when.
I remember this movie when I was younger. Loved it then and I still love it.

This is a movie I watched years ago as a teenager on TV. I really like this movie because it really has a good message of never giving up, and how important family is. I am glad that I now have it on dvd to watch it again and again.
Thursday's Child is a nice movie.  The characters are likeable and the stars very good.  Pretty much a TV movie from that era.  Like and Early Frost of a few years later.

Thursday's child is a wonderful movie.  It shows a heartfelt illness faced with courage from both the mother's and teen's persective, as well as touching on the father's and siblings' coping with the impending crisis of illness.  Great story and wonderful acting.
The quality of the DVD is not very good even though the story is. I just would not recommend anyone to pay this much money for the quality of the DVD.
